kbItems.question: Why was the policy regarding Industrialized (Mobile) Devices created?
kbItems.answer: Industrialized (Mobile) Devices policy has been created by Ryan Bryers to provide guidance on Industrialized mobile devices (mobile handsets and tablets) that should be used for Products & Solutions.

kbItems.question: What does Industrialized mobile devices mean?
kbItems.answer:
As mobile solutions are a key part of our Arsenal we become responsible for the full managed
service to a mobile device, this is something that is very difficult to offer on a commercial device as
we have no control of deprecation rates or access to upgrades & patches. Where we are to be
responsible for the full managed services on a mobile device we must use a Industrialized device.

kbItems.question: What is Industrialized mobile device?
kbItems.answer:
As mobile solutions are a key part of our Arsenal we become responsible for the full managed
service to a mobile device, this is something that is very difficult to offer on a commercial device as
we have no control of deprecation rates or access to upgrades & patches. Where we are to be
responsible for the full managed services on a mobile device we must use a Industrialized device.

kbItems.question: What are the responsibilities of Industrialized mobile devices
kbItems.answer: Keeping the devices in support, Refreshing the devices when out of support, Keeping the operating system up to date, Keeping monthly patches installed and current, Applying security patches immediately to close a vulnerability, Ensuring the availability of replacement devices

kbItems.question: What constitutes Industrialized mobile device?
kbItems.answer: Mobile handsets and tablets
